availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Edward Eubanks (Russell County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Epperson Eubanks in Adair County, Kentucky, on April 17, 1849. Father of William Eubanks, Margaret Eubanks, W. C. A. Eubanks, and Joshua Eubanks. Blacksmith in Russell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Russell County in 1860. Employed Henry Taylor as a laborer in Russell County in 1860. Blacksmith in Russell County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 71A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 703-4.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Russell County, KY, February 1864, p. 46.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film 000830576.
